lucky gunner   clear gel  Dismissed off the bat not that it matters you can find loads in 9mm thatll expand 100 as well Even if you couldnt it still wouldnt matter because the difference between a 6 hole in you and a 8 hole in you isnt enough difference to matter and certainly isnt enough difference to matter more than having a greater number of 6 ones in you This shit aint theory at this point it isnt the 80s anymore All these meme cartridges like 10mm super hot 45 and 5746 have been tested evaluated issued and dropped  I capped them from but I believe both are federal hst  Thats extremely aberrative performance for a 9mm HST probably one of those paul harrell tests where he shot a leather jacket covering a bag of oranges and called it a test In actual testing and in real world shootings HST does not perform like that     Brainlet take after watching literally hundreds of shootings reading AARs and reading expert opinions from peoiple who have actually been there and done that ill tell you what matters in a gun fight is rarely the first shotunless its a CNS hit in which case caliber barely matters and practically never the latter shots of a higher capacity firearmunless cover was involved What matters is the first 35 shots and how quicklyaccurately they were placed faster is better and decent upper chest placement is needed if you cannot connect with the CNS This is what determines the VAST majority of gunfight winners and is exactly what lower recoil cartridges like 9mm excel at and 9mm does it with ubiquity and a low price

No neither of those are safe to carry with 6      I think youre confusing two separate things 1 Some revolvers mainly older percussion aka capandball models have notches between each chamber on the cylinder If you put the hammer down in one of these notches the gun is safe to carry fully loaded One example of a modern gun that has these is the NAA minrevolvers like picrel Again these revolvers are safe to carry fully loaded with the hammer down in one of those notches However the Colt SAA doesnt have these 2 There are notches in the hammer on singleaction revolvers including Colt SAAs halfcock and then full cock Some people mistakenly call the halfcock notch a safety notch This is incorrect and it is NOT safe to carry a Colt SAA on halfcock because the halfcock notch is physically small and weak a blow to the hammer or dropping the gun can break it and cause the gun to fire  Modern reproductions of these guns are safe so are later Colt models Those have transfer bars firing pin blocks andor inertial firing pins so they are safe to carry fully loaded

The Battle of the Points in WW2 was an equally ridiculous shitshow  In the Philippines after the initial Japanese first strike after the attack on Pearl Harbor the entire US combat air fleet is destroyed on the ground thanks to MacArthur trying and failing to politick   with no aircraft left to fly and maintain the surviving airmen are given surplus WW1 equipment and sent off to Bataan to fight as infantrymen along with the remaining shore based Navy sailors on the island   thanks to Japanese incompetence their advance on Bataan is blunted by a combined USFilipino defensive line Reinforcements are requested and troops from recently conqured Malaya and Singapore are sent in to break the stalemate   A Japanese plan is made to land troops at the tip of the Bataan peninsula to cut off allied troops from their dwindling supply dumps   the Army and Navy predictably squabble endlessly over who will lead this attack Eventually the Army is chosen for the landing   the Navy is NOT happy for being passed over and decide to take their revenge by having their planes and ships orbit around the chosen landing beaches for the lulz   the Allies notice this and realize something is going down The only problem is all the available combat units are stuck on the Moro line containing the Japanese advance   a combined force of US airmen sailors marine embassy guards that were evacuated from China before the war Filipino police officers airmen and ROTC cadets were able to be mobilized and sent to the beaches in time   the Air Corps having the only transportation units amongst the allied defenders were well equipped by stealing equipment earmarked for other units and had obtained backpack radios mortars stolen Canadian bren gun carriers and were able to convert their ANM2 50 aircraft machine guns to be fired on the ground   the Navy on the other hand had not been taking the prospect of combat so seriously

Could the president or executive office not order a federal gun confiscation or a crackdown on nonNFAcompliant suppressors   A Second Amendment sanctuary also known as a gun sanctuary is a state county or locality in the United States that has adopted laws or resolutions to prohibit or impede the enforcement of certain gun control measures which are perceived to violate the Second Amendment such as universal gun background checks high capacity magazine bans assault weapon bans red flag laws etc    MONTGOMERY WBMA  Gov Kay Ivey released a statement Wednesday afternoon announcing she signed Senate Bill 2 also known as the Alabama Second Amendment Protection Act sponsored by Sen Gerald Allen R  SD21    The bill prohibits the state and political subdivisions of the state and their law enforcement officers agents and employees from participating in the implementation or enforcement of any federal act law order rule or regulation relating to firearms firearm accessories or ammunition It also provides criminal penalties for a violation   This additional information is also worth considering Im not going to call you a retard in return it just seems unkind to the mentally disabled One could probably buybuild a suppressor without paperwork but I reckon it would just give the feds an excuse to raid you for whatever reason  Then again even if you milled your own receiver an NFAregistered suppressor would be compliance to Constitutional infringement and a paper trail Im a law abiding citizen dont want to live like an outlaw on the run or a rat in hiding

Its okay NDs simply regularly happen to anyone who owns guns   At friends apartment at college Just bought my first pistol from a gun show I was 18   Drinking with friends   Show them my new Jericho   Try to manually decock   Thumb slips on hammer ND into celling   Upstairs neighbors too high and drunk underage and illegal drugs to call the police   Second time  At range   Showing friend pistol   Think gun is unloaded   Point at ground show him how to wrack and pull the trigger   Forgot loaded mag in   Shoot between his feet   Third time  At parents house   Just bought a sig from a guy   Get home   Try swapping slides with another sig I had   Forgot the other sig slide was chambered   Pull trigger   Shoot parents wall   Fourth time  At my new house   Playing with a friends 556 AK   Release bolt   Slam fires round into ground   Fifth time  Showing a friend how to use it   No idea how but a round got chambered   Show him how the trigger works   Pull trigger   Shoots round into floor in the same place as before   Sixth time  Thought maybe the house was haunted   Grab a sig   Physically clear it racked the slide 3 times with no magazine in    pull trigger at the same hole   Round goes off   Seventh time  Friend brings over a used Glock wants me to look over it   I grab it and pull the trigger without clearing it   Didnt even realize the thing was loaded   Eighth time  Friend brings over his transferable Mac 10   I had no idea how open bolt guns worked   Hes showing it off to me   I put a loaded mag it and decided to try and release the bolt I thought it shot from a closed bolt   Pulled the trigger for some reason   Shot 3 rounds into my wall   Ninth time   get a grenade launcher gifted to me    fiddle with it a bit cant figure out how to open the breech   its probably empty anyway point at a nearby wall    it actually fires the grenade punches through the wall and detonates in the other room

Im very much literate unlike my sharecropping ancestors Ive even worked as a writer for a living That is why I take grammar so seriously as it was my job  You are confusing genuinely meaningful discussion on gun rights with posturing I would reckon this comes from a place of insecurity       Im referring to both laws together Maybe I should have been more clear in my communication  The state and local law enforcement openly refuses to cooperate with the BATF on NFA enforcement as a 2nd Amendment sanctuary state This new law extends the practice to executive order  In general the BATF relies on the cooperation of local and state law enforcement to enforce the NFA Im not asking if I should build an illegal suppressor It is like the marijuana dispensaries that were legal under state law and selectively raided by feds until they werent  There is a grey area here We could obtain suppressors without compliance to the NFA and the state and local LE would not take issue with it but the feds could still selectively enforce it with their own task force or team without the help of local and state LE  My question is this  Should I just go ahead and obtain a suppressor without complying to the NFA which I believe infringes on the Constitution or would it not be worth attracting the attention of federal agents who could potentially selectively enforce it despite Alabama being a 2A sanctuary  Im a law abiding citizen and dont want to live like a fugitive just because I have a metal can that sticks on the end of my rifle which is often overpriced as a result of the NFA Criminals dont have to worry about gun laws but Id much rather obey the law Such a simple device becomes complicated for law abiding citizens because of these laws  Im not one of those guys who thinks it is badass or clever to play games with the law

I dont think its necessary when the danger is obvious With the original guns the firing pin rests straight on the primer with the gun at rest If you put it at halfcock there is theoretically a small piece of metal preventing the hammer from falling but this is weak and easily broken Its not like there is any wonder if this is a problem or not for the SAA Sixguns by Keith mentions a few people by name who accidentally shot themselves in the leg or the foot while saddling a horse and the stirrup hit the hammer on their holstered revolver This was also the impetus for all sorts of later technology meant to solve the problem Inertial firing pins transfer bars hammer blocks and so on were invented to solve the problem  picrel shows two colt SAA hammers The one on the left is intact the one on the right has the halfcock notch broken off

What got me on it was how looking for an integrally suppressed AR upper returned a bunch of 16 inch 4064 cm uppers which to me sounds completely stupid when theres stuff like 300 blk where you can use a 9 inch 2286 cm barrelalthough I suppose a 9 inch 2286 cm barrel and a 1011 inch suppressor is longer than 16 inches 4064 cm overall   dunno its kind of in the fuck you I want it because its cool category  Yes I think youre kinda missing the point anon Like taking your example while you can get way with 8 300bo really does gain a solid amount from another 2 so 10 68 of can is very reasonable for 30cal you might want to use supers sometimes as well so you end up at or near 16 combined anyway Which is still much better if you started at 16 youd be at 2224 or more But if theyre separate what you have is two tax stamps plus one of them is an SBR If you want to take that to another state you have to file travel permission forms  Whereas if its integral the length of the can legally counts towards barrel length and OAL 16 barrel 88 or 97 or 106 or whatever and 26 OAL  one stamp suppressor only and suppressors and AOW are the only ones that dont require any sort of travel stuff  How much this really matters beyond cool varies If you live in a huge state like Texas and basically never take your guns elsewhere whatever If you live in a tiny state like I do and very regularly go to friendsfamily in another state its a nice convenience  Either way though just get an integral barrel assembly in a normal gun The entire assembly is the suppressor Nothing special on the gun side is necessary

So far unfortunately the only auction site Ive been using proxy bid hasnt had multiples of the same rifle in the same auction And every item I have wanted is almost always been some the last lots        Its been almost 5 years since I have had a LGS nearby that regularly has any kind of milsurp I have found one store that usually has some pretty interesting things but its unfortunately 30 minutes outoftheway for me so hard to justify checking it out regularly They had a trench gun that I missed by one day There are plenty of gun stores near me but all of them are modern new production boring stuff Fayetteville has a surprising amount of good gun stores with very interesting items and pretty friendly staff Unfortunately one that has the things I want but the owner wont sell since they are part of his collection on display I would love to be able to make the rounds through there often but Im almost an hour away and never have a reason to travel down there otherwise      I still remember and just barely missed the 69 mosins I got my first back in 2012 for 150 with accessories and I got really lucky and scored and absolutely beautiful exsniper the single nicest MosinNagant I have ever seen or held Im still debating whether or not I want to restore it to a sniper since exsnipers are an interesting category of their own       Same whenever I would move into a new area I would always take a weekend or two to check out all of the LGS in my region as a way of both learning the lay of the land navigation and also to see what kind of stores are even worth my time Through this method I have been able to write off a number of stores out right so I save my time

There are plenty of autos over 5 but if you intend to get or have a silencer standard velocity ammo marked as 1070fps starts getting supersonic around 45 5 pushes it over In my experience anyway at my elevation Barrel length doesnt have anything to do with accuracy though doesnt matter if its 10 or 2 all barrel length does is change velocity and give you a longer sight radius which is irrelevant with a red dot  Are you also trying to be cheap That wasnt clear from the OP because thats a 800 gun so I was thinking in that vein  Ruger is a great option you can get a Mark or 2245 under 400 or you can find a TX22 Competition for about 360 which has a threaded barrel and optic mount Theyre not as accurate as a Mark from a bench but they are much more accurate than the regular TX22 I mentioned because on the Competition the optic mounts directly to the barrel so the slop in a TX22 doesnt matter They have very good triggers too but not as good as something like OP

The TX22 Competition doesnt come with a red dot but it can accept dots of multiple patterns Youll have to buy one separate a decent one is about 160 and up  Im sure theres some spin ratetoammo velocity combination that will make super short barrels less accurate but if youre talking 25 barrel length is not a contributing factor to accuracy however a longer sight radius on a longer barrel will allow YOU to be more accurate with the gun since the increased distance between sights allows you to see and correct minute imperfections more easily but you would need to be a very good shooter to notice a difference Manufacturing quality will though so a cheap 3 may be less accurate than a midgrade 8  For an example here are some targets of mine This is about the level of accuracy Im capable of shooting unsupported at 25 yards These are full size 9mms with 55 barrels with red dots

Maybe this is legal in your country  In Germany underwater harpoon devices are not explicitly equipped with ammunition gunpowder and are largely exempt from the weapons law Every adult citizen who has not been explicitly banned from using weapons is allowed to explore and use the ScubaRinger freely Carrying in public is also permitted This will most likely not change with the upcoming 2020 Weapons Act the text of the law is already known as it was finally passed by the Bundestag and Bundesrat in 2019 Harpoon devices are and remain free     The Scuba Ringer has two shots and is loaded with two compressed air cartridges to which arrow firing tubes are screwed These cartridges are reusable and can be filled with a hand pump a compressed air bottle or a compressor 250 to 300 bar The cartridges with the firing tubes and attached arrows can be reloaded like a breakbarrel shotgun  remove the fired cartridge and insert the loaded cartridge     As with all other items the same applies In a real emergency situation the use of the Scuba Ringer can be legal if there is no other way to ward off the attack    Warning Like any other harpoon device the Scuba Ringer is deadly especially when used as intended against water and mammals

Unfortunately the concept this vehicle is based on is thoroughly retarded and was never going to be good even without the questionable build quality  You see this vehicle was born to combat an issue In Grozny during the Chechen Wars people would shoot tanks with RPGs from the roofs of buildings and the T72s which often went into urban fights with no infantry support couldnt raise their guns high enough to shoot back  Now a normal and rational country would look at the problems caused by unsupported tank rushes through urban environments and go huh maybe we could combine our arms and support are tanks in an environment in which they face a massive disadvantage  However Russia said that the issue wasnt that they were sending columns of tanks into cities unsupported No the real issue you see is that they were sending the wrong type of tank into the cities completely unsupported and that if they just gave it a smaller gun that could hit the guys shooting at everyone apart from the lead and rear tank everything would be fine and they wouldnt have to do something boring like giving infantry a proper way to communicate and work with their armour support  And so the Terminator was born

And FPVs  Drones are much more complicated Why Because this is a technology that absolutely everyone has to deal with If beforehand we made fun of Russians for putting grills on their tanks now we have to adapt and build similar devices in but in different configurations There are three main ways to protect yourself from such things The first is the timely detection and use of electronic warfare equipment which is so powerful that it would make drones lose control not only of the FPVs but also of other drones The second way is to shoot them down by all possible means which means using up ammunition Even if you create some kind of barrage fire from a squad or platoon you need to spend a lot of ammunition to shoot them down And the third is the use of these socalled visors The russians have begun to install antidrone superstructures and show them at the exhibition and the troops have even started to use Kontakt1 dynamic protection elements on top of tanks on superstructures They are trying to make the most of all the opportunities they have Sooner or later we will probably come to the same conclusion We will use the same kind of polyamide nets and we will cover not only the turret but possibly the engine and transmission And in the war between Hamas and the IDF we have already seen on Merkava IVs the same industrially produced or ad hoc roofs over tank turrets in order to protect the tanks from dronedropped munitions or FPV drones The main method will probably be to saturate the army with electronic warfare equipment and it is desirable that each tank and IFV has an individual electronic warfare device 7x

As for the tank programmable munitions do we use them   Lets put it this way in order to use programmable ammunition you need to install a special programmer Accordingly this can only be done by those who developed this ammunition and developed the system for its use And this will either be done during modernization here in Ukraine which means that these vehicles must be taken off the battlefield for some time to some place  But only in case those munitions will be supplied to us  Yes  But we have them  So these processes happened  No but you need a special gun to fire them that is on Leopard 2A6  This is not about the gun but about the programmer Such equipment can also be installed on other guns But in the basic version a specific gun leaves the factory which allows the use of specific ammunition And guns that were produced earlier can be upgraded to this level But this installation of additional equipment means time certain funds and the availability of such equipment Therefore if we receive say a batch of Leopard 2A6 vehicles that can use this ammunition it means that this ammunition will go to this particular brigade to this tank battalion No questions will arise here If we want more then we will have to raise the question of what we need  Is there any information on their use  No info   What about armorpiercing ammunition for Leopard 2  The armorpiercing ammunition that Ukraine has received from our Western allies pen absolutely all armored vehicles that appear on the battlefield at the range of effective use of the Leopard 2A4 tanks guns ie at a range of 354 kilometers  Ill add a remark that we got the DM53s from Germany and we are supposed to get DM63 next year  Is there a need for a programmer  No you just need to update the ballistic computer with new data A representative of the manufacturer has to come with a laptop  17x

So we have a source of parts  There are absolutely no problems with spare parts for the T72 in Europe Including engines  this is an engine for many vehicles and engineering equipment  Youve also mentioned that some crews already replace a second barrel Do we have any problems with that  Lets put it this way There are factoryfresh guns they are 1st category and there are guns that made 3 shots and they are 2nd category But it has no more than 15 mm of wear and it can do 700 standard shots before reaching 33 mm of maximum allowed wear  You mean 700 APFSDS shots  No its either HE or HEAT With APFSDS situation is different since different shells induce different wear on the barrel BM42 Mango which are the most common and best shells that we and russsian have They have to be recorded as 5 standard shots in the log If the gun is certified to do 650 shots one can only make 130 APFSDS shots with it before needing replacement But Ive seen a barrel that had as much as 46 mm of wear making it almost a 130 mm cannon  And what about ammo for tanks especially subcaliber ammunition We know that for some time we had a shortage of highexplosive ammunition and we started making our own  Again the 125millimeter caliber is used by China Pakistan and North Korea There are several European countries so it all depends on whether the parliaments of these countries allocated money for the purchase of ammunition for Ukraine in time or not You understand the RussoUkrainian war resulted in a situation where ammunition marked and munitions price increased multifold So when beforehand we were promised 1 million shells the funds that were allocated for that can buy only 500k   What does an average ammunition package for a Ukrainian tank look like What kind of ammunition is it at what proportions  These are highexplosive fragmentation shells  80 sometimes 90 percent A couple of APFSDS rounds and a few HEAT rounds 25x

Finalizing question Future Ukrainian IFV  CV90 Maybe other vehicle Nowadays the difference between APCs and IFVs are fading away Maybe Stryker  Stryker is for light brigades And its a very specific machine maybe for a different army I dont think our army is quite ready to use it Its an entirely different information environment constant air support attack helicopters and so on This is a fast vehicle but its main purpose especially for the version with 50 cal on top is to deliver the infantry to the battlefield and to then support if from distance  And an infantry support vehicle I think they meant M1128 MGS   This is a serious and technologically demanding equipment It has a complicated feeding mechanism expensive maintenance expensive ammunition for the lowimpulse gun This is not a system for a mass army  There has been news about memorandum for 1000 CV90  Now CV90 is THE IFV Its an accomplished IFV It was good protection good armaments wonderful transmission a hard to kill engine The only limit is how many we would be able to buy and at what price  And the production rate and delivery date  If theyll be paid a fair price the manufacturer will be able scale production And we can localize it  There are options and we need to chose the main variant we want  Our future IFV in light of drone proliferation should it have reactive armor What caliber of the gun should it have 30 or 40mm How many infantrymen should it carry 6810  An IFV shouldnt carry 10 people The more reasonable number in 6 since the small arms are taking up more space and personal protection adds bulk And with the exoskeletons likely coming into play 6 is good number Caliber depends on the design goals and the requirements of the Directorate for Strategic Development at the General Staff Why Because a 40mm cannon means airburst substantial HE effects Same can be done for 30mm shell but the price will be entirely different 34x

HESH is excellent against fortifications which is why the bongs kept rifled guns for so long They need rifled guns to work well though Cant say anything more than an educated guess about performance against Soviet tanks but likely not that effective from the frontal aspect They still had layered upper glacises and later models in particular improved A and B though adherence to standards on upgraded vehicles is not always guaranteed had spaced armor which would have vastly improved protection against HESH same with the turret cheeks Theres a lot of shit on the sides that gets in the way of a good shot connecting onto the side armor too Theyd obviously perform better than HE alone but theres no point comparing them because neither was being used for AT at that point Both will kill a soft vehicle deader than dead so theres no point comparing there either

Best weapon to take down these guys  armor resists handgun rounds and shotgun buck but thankfully doesnt cover center mass but their sheer bulk and resilient physiology means that even highcaliber rounds arent a sure thing 357 magnum 556 and other high velocity rounds can penetrate their armor but can only reliably bring them down if you hose them down in it the bigger issue is that regular fire and maneuver will be difficult since glancing shots down reliably bring them down they are much harder to pin with supressing fire while their thornets will make midair turns so they can pin you down even if they are making on the move snap shots  thornets have poor effect on target even level IIIa vests can resist them but the aforementioned semihoming qualities of their rounds means they can achieve positional superiority anyways by allowing them to reliably get rounds on target regardless of whether they are aiming or if the target is obscured  there might be no legitimate way to counter them other than brute force ie explosives multiple 30cal and above weapons which might not be an option if they are teleporting en masse

This was posted in the comments of the Soldiersystems article by the account M4 user  11usairforcesmallarmsupdate comment1059720   People are misunderstanding the 20 MOA thing It is not a 20 MOA shooter group It is    M4 with RAS and 2510x magnified optic using MK262 MOD 1 Zeroed neutrally without any outside influence on the handguard 110 round groups fired at 100m and 200m for baseline Then the same repeated from 9 different positions    Prone Mag monopod   Prone Sandbagged   Prone with sling   Prone with bipod   Prone with handguard resting on wood   Prone with guard resting on metal   Prone using VFG   Kneeling using barricad rifle supported in rear   Prone with light and laser attached    Each position was measured and plotted on every target Target was an NRA B8 bull overlaid on a standard EType When complete the targets from an unfloated M4 averaged over 20moa for all shots For an optimized M4 FF stiff handguard Geissele SSF etc the average was 37moa    The testing was done with 20 shooters from multiple branches Shooters ranged from average infantry skill to high master Service Rifle competitors and top level 3gunners    People can think what they want about USAF shooting however this test was done correctly and has been verified twice since It will be verified again shortly   Do with this what you will

When considering a compactsized sidearm to complement an AR especially if youre interested in options similar to the Glock 19 but with a manual safety there are several notable firearms you might consider  1 Smith  Wesson MP9 Shield 20 Known for its reliability and quality its compact and comes with a thumb safety option Its a popular choice for concealed carry  2 Sig Sauer P320 Compact This model offers a modular design allowing customization to your liking While it doesnt come with a traditional manual safety there are versions with this feature  3 Ruger Security9 This is a more budgetfriendly option that still offers good quality It features a secure action hammer and a builtin safety mechanism  4 CZ P10 C Known for its ergonomics and shooting comfort the P10 C is another option similar in size to the Glock 19 It has a firing pin block safety and trigger safety  5 Beretta APX Compact This firearm is known for its durability and reliability It offers a strikerfired design with a passive safety system  6 FN 509 Midsize This model offers a good balance of size and performance with a fully ambidextrous slide stop lever and magazine release Some versions come with a manual safety  Each of these options has its unique features and ergonomics so its a good idea to handle and if possible test fire them to see which feels best for you Remember to consider factors like magazine capacity caliber grip comfort and the overall feel of the gun when making your decision

Awesome  Im not sure what kind of ammo is available there but we have defensive loads in 147gr from all the big names Federal Winchester Speer etc which are very effective hollow point rounds For instance Winchester RA9T is 990 fps RA9B1 is 1010 fps and Federal HST 147 gr is 1000 fps Anything under about 1070fps is subsonic a sea level and these are very respectable defensive loads  But I just meant try some cheap 147gr to see how quiet it can be no sense blasting this expensive ammo      Youll have to work that out with your local FFL but most will expect the gun to at least be in a shipping box unsealed so they can verify to log it in and out But yeah find a box that fits bring the gun shipping box and a printout of the receiving FFL and youll be charged for the transfer if not also shipping My RIA was prepaid so when I took it in to an FFL they reduced the fee to account for prepaid shipping  Maybe they can look it up but when the UPSFedex policy changed I noticed warranty departments started including copies of the FFL along with prepaid labels to make things easier  Its really gay now
